text: The Vice-President of the Arab Republic of Egypt is a senior official within the Egyptian government. == List of officeholders == This list contains Vice- Presidents of United Arab Republic (1958–71, included Syria until the 1961 coup d'état) and Arab Republic of Egypt (1971–present). Portrait Name (Birth–Death) Term of office Political party President Took office Left office Time in office 1 Sabri al-Asali صبري العسلي (1903–1976) National Party Nasser Akram al-Hawrani أكرم الحوراني (1912–1996) Ba'ath Party Nasser Abdel Latif Boghdadi عبد اللطيف البغدادي (1917–1999) National Union Nasser Arab Socialist Union Abdel Hakim Amer محمد عبد الحكيم عامر (1919–1967) National Union Nasser Arab Socialist Union 5 Nur al-Din Kahala نور الدين كحالة (1908–1965) National Union Nasser 6 Abdel Hamid al-Sarraj عبد الحميد السراج (1925–2013) National Union Nasser Kamal el-Din Hussein كمال الدين حسين (1921–1999) National Union Nasser Arab Socialist Union Zakaria Mohieddin زكريا محيى الدين (1918–2012) National Union Nasser Arab Socialist Union Hussein el-Shafei حسين محمود حسن الشافعي (1918–2005) National Union Nasser Arab Socialist Union 10 Anwar Sadat أنور السادات (1918–1981) Arab Socialist Union Nasser Hassan Ibrahim حسن ابراهيم (1917–1990) Arab Socialist Union Nasser Zakaria Mohieddin زكريا محيى الدين (1918–2012) Arab Socialist Union Nasser 12 Ali Sabri على صبرى (1920–1991) Arab Socialist Union Nasser Hussein el-Shafei حسين محمود حسن الشافعي (1918–2005) Arab Socialist Union Nasser Sadat Anwar Sadat أنور السادات (1918–1981) Arab Socialist Union Nasser 13 Ali Sabri على صبرى (1920–1991) Arab Socialist Union Sadat 14 Mahmoud Fawzi محمود فوزى (1900–1981) Arab Socialist Union Sadat Vacant (–) 15 Hosni Mubarak حسنى مبارك (1928–2020) Arab Socialist Union Sadat National Democratic Party Vacant (–) 16 Omar Suleiman عمر سليمان (1936–2012) Independent Mubarak Vacant (–) 17 Mahmoud Mekki محمود مكي (1954–) Independent Morsi Vacant (–) Post abolished (–) — Mohamed ElBaradei محمد البرادعي (1942–) Constitution Party Mansour Vacant (–) Post abolished (–) Vacant (–present) ==References==
